chess

Class Rook

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Piece
      • chess.Rook

  • public class Rook
extends chess.Piece
    The Rook class represents a rook object
    Author:
    Justin Saganowski, Emily Tregelles

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class chess.Piece

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isValidPath(chess.Tile start, chess.Tile end)
      The isValidPath method checks if the rook is moving laterally If one of the ranks is the same between start to end, it is a valid move
      boolean move_check(chess.Tile end)
      The move_check method determines if a move is legal
      void move(chess.Tile end)
      The move method checks if it is a valid move and that the end tile is currently reachable by the piece.
      chess.Tile[] possibleMove()
      The possibleMove method determines which locations on the board can be legally reached by the piece
      boolean validOutOfCheck(chess.Tile end_tile)
      The validOutOfCheck method checks if moving a king to the specified tile will successfully get it out of check

      • move

        public void move(chess.Tile end)
        The move method checks if it is a valid move and that the end tile is currently reachable by the piece. If so, update the currentTile to the end tile.
        Specified by:

      • isValidPath

        public boolean isValidPath(chess.Tile start,
                           chess.Tile end)
        The isValidPath method checks if the rook is moving laterally If one of the ranks is the same between start to end, it is a valid move
